explanation: [0-0] A rustic silver ring with an amber stone is clamped in a silver-black machine, a thin steel wire on the right side of the ring. The background is a yellow and white surface.

[0-8] Then the thin steel wire moves from right to left, cutting the amber stone from the middle, dust scattering, and the word "AMBER" appears at the top of the screen. A pair of tweezers first removes the upper and lower parts of the cut amber stone. Then the right hand takes the ring circle and puts it into a small crucible with white powder, then puts the previously cut part of the ring into the small crucible, then the flame ignites, melting the ring inside, a small ball of molten metal color appears at the bottom of the small crucible, and some black residue around the small ball.
